steps.title: Apply some blue painter's tape to the walls where they meet the ceiling.
steps.content: Apply some blue painter's tape to the walls where they meet the ceiling. The tape will help protect the walls from drips or from accidental smears. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure the tape is properly stuck.
steps.content: Make sure the tape is properly stuck. Press the tape down on the wall as tightly as possible to keep any excess paint from leaking in behind it. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Dip the brush just enough.
steps.content: Dip the brush just enough. Dip your paintbrush approximately halfway into the paint so the paint does not over-saturate the bristles.

steps.title: Start painting.
steps.content: Start painting. Begin on the left side of the wall if you are right handed; if you are left handed, begin on the right side of the wall. This will allow you to pull the brush at a comfortable angle, which will help you avoid mistakes or paint smears.

steps.title: Hold the brush against the ceiling.
steps.content: Hold the brush against the ceiling. This is so only the tips of the bristles rest against it without bending. This will hold the handle of the brush closer to the ceiling.

steps.title: Apply the paint evenly.
steps.content: Apply the paint evenly. Brush along the ceiling in short strokes, stopping as often as needed to reload the brush with paint.

steps.title: Create a smooth finish.
steps.content: Create a smooth finish. Smooth out the brush marks along the ceilingâ€™s edge by going over the paint a second time.

steps.title: Hold the brush against the ceiling with the handle of the brush below the bristles.
steps.content: Hold the brush against the ceiling with the handle of the brush below the bristles. This will bend the bristles of the brush so the long fibers of the brush, rather than the tips, are in contact with the ceiling. Applying the brush this way will remove many of the brush marks that can be left behind by a paintbrush, and provide you with a smooth edge.

steps.title: Evenly cover the edges.
steps.content: Evenly cover the edges. Move on to the interior of the ceiling, overlapping the brushstrokes with a roller just slightly to provide a clean surface on the ceiling with no visible edge where the brushwork begins. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Allow it to dry.
steps.content: Allow it to dry. Wait until the paint has dried, then remove the tape from the walls. [4] X Research source
